reviewText: An excellent movie followed, surprisingly, by an exellent TV series.  I hope the series continues.  Not only have my grandkids enjoyed watching the episodes, but I found I could watch along with them.
I like that the author return to the aspect of the original movie, friendship and discovery. The visual aspect is fine. Hope to leave this hystory between the bad guys and the good guys ...
price was too high for the product with cross boarder fees and postage added could have purchased for $12.00 here
I haven't seen them all but good to have the TV series that will connect the two movies. I'm also glad they are starting to release figures.

The tv show is just more of the same goodness, without any sign of sequel fatigue. More dragons, more adventures, the only downpoint is a lack of insight of the production; there is one, but it only leaves a door opened, having you want more !

Dragons: Riders of Berk Part 2 picks up following the events of the feature film How to Train Your Dragon (Two-Disc Blu-ray/DVD Combo + Dragon Double Pack) [Blu-ray] and the holiday special DreamWorks Dragons: Gift of the Night Fury / Book of Dragons Double Pack (Two-Disc Blu-ray/DVD Combo + Online Video Game). Luckily many of the original voice cast from the feature film return to voice their characters in this Cartoon Network TV Series. The few voices that had to be recast are masterfully done to where they sound very much like their feature film counterparts. Beyond the voice acting, the stories & animation present in this 1st season are top-notch and are a great way to pass the time until the 2nd feature film due out in 2014. One touch I like is how Hiccup narrates the beginning & end of the episodes as he did in the original film. Part 2 consists of 2 discs with the remaining 9 episodes of season 1; each episode running approximately 22 1/2 minutes. Each disc features a "play all" function for the episodes. The dvd case comes with a slipcover and has two slips inside: one is a code for the Ultimate Battle Pack to be used in the online/mobile game School of Dragons (limited time offer); the other is a coupon good for $3 off on a new Defenders of Berk Action Dragon Toy (coupon valid from 7/30/13 to 1/31/14). The first 11 episodes of season 1 can be found on Dragons: Riders of Berk - Part 1 I personally am very pleased with the video & audio presentation of the episodes. The audio is available only in English with Dolby Digital 5.1; subtitles are available in English, Spanish, and French. As with most, if not all, DreamWorks releases one of the special features is the World of DreamWorks Animation which features sneak peeks into other DreamWorks animation properties. Another Sneak Peeks section also includes some other animation theatrical trailers as well as a look at the Dragon toys for which the included coupon can be used. "Dragon Tracker Part 2" provides an overview of the 3 new types of dragons introduced in the included 9 episodes. "Evolution of Whispering Death" is a behind the scenes look at the creation of one of these new dragons. The final bonus feature is a music video titled "Fly High" Dragon Mash-Up. The actual episodes on the 2 discs are as follows: 12) Thawfest (my favorite of the 1st season episodes) 13) When Lightning Strikes 14) What Flies Beneath 15) Twinsanity 16) Defiant One 17) Breakneck Bog 18) Gem of a Different Color 19) We Are Family Part 1 20) We Are Family Part 2 Regarding my rating of 4 stars, I based it mainly upon a semi-weak selection of bonus features. It would have been nice to see much more substantial behind the scenes features on the animation & voice talent behind this wonderful series along with possibly some deleted/abandoned scenes/story ideas and some episode commentaries. Offering the series in Blu-ray would have been good, too, as well as a single full season release vs 2 separate volumes. The series, itself, I rate 5 stars and highly recommend it to anyone who is a fan of the original film. And while it would have been great to have a single full season release, don't let that stop you from picking up this terrific series; the pricing is reasonable enough to allow for purchasing both volumes. Plus you'll want to get ready for the start of season 2: Defenders of Berk which begins in September. And if you haven't seen the original feature film yet, why not??? It's definitely recommended viewing and should be seen before beginning the TV series; trust me: you'll love it!

What do they mean "Part 2" and How can they have a DVD of "season 2" when it is not yet released??
How about a list of what Episodes are on this DVD please!?!
People, listen up: Season Two is NOT out yet, in fact, Season One just recently wrapped up!

Previous reviewer is confused...there has been only one season of this program...the sequel to the first movie is in the works.  The first 4 episodes already released on DVD this year, but I can't find any information as to what is on these new 'part one & part two' DVD releases...is this the whole season one? Part of season one? Do these discs pick up where the first DVD before part one ended, or are there redundant episodes with an expectation to 'double dip' & buy same consecutive episodes twice? Odd to omit both episode lists and picture of back of DVD packaging to help consumer know what is being sold here....we usually have this info by release date, which is today. Great show, misleading, cryptic solicitation and product description. Show gets 5 stars....great program.

Hands down, one of my favorite kids shows...ever.  And that's saying a lot...as I said in the title, I've got three kids, and over the years I've seen pretty much everything there is for kids to watch.  If you like the "How to Train Your Dragon" movies, you'll love these.  There's enough episodes that they have the time to explore all of the characters (and their dragons) much more in-depth than they ever could in a movie (and yes, I just said that about a computer generated kids cartoon).  The animation gets better and better as the show progresses, until it's at least as good as the first movie.  The series has a nice mix of action (that's not so scary I wouldn't let my 4 (now 5) year old watch it, and it humor--some of which is only going to be funny to adults which is a nice nod to the fact that grownups will be watching too.  Ruff Nut and Tuff Nut always crack me up lol.
Anyway, it's a great series that the whole family can enjoy.  I almost never give five stars to anything...but I gave it this show.
Yes much like

I love How To Train Your Dragon. I love the silliness of the characters! They can be serious too. I felt like a kid again watching it! I love the shenanigans too! SO many fun adventures that I love watching over and over and over again! With this crew you'll never be bored!

This is a really cute spin off of the how to train your dragon Movies. This is season 1 of the Cartoon network series. All the characters from the movie are there. The twins still dumb as ever. Astrid is tough girl, and the girl Hiccup has a crush on. Snotlout still the tough guy, and Fishlegs the dragon fact expert. The dragons are there, Toothless of course plus a whole number of dragons not seen in the movie.
My 13 year old son and I both love the How to Dragon your Dragon TV series. So worth watching, whether you have kiddos or not.

Most of these are excellent, but they took a tail-spin on the last 2 episodes of the 2nd DVD.  The writer left the humor behind and took a dive into Treachery, Deceit, and Lying...  Just what I wanted to teach my kids!!!  NOT
They need to fire the writer of these 2 (connected) episodes or keep him on his meds.

However the episodes before these 2 bombs make the set worth getting for all Berk Dragon fans.

How to Train your dragon was hard to follow up, but Dream Works outdid themselves with this series. Packed with more dragons and more characters, these stories can be funny, epic, or touching, all at once. Some parts of  the series can be crude, with a few jokes and some less than funny moments, but nothing that is new for animation. The bad guys are well made and send chills down your spine, and Hiccup has you rooting for him the whole time as he tries to protect those he loves the most. A well done, suspenseful dvd that makes you hungry for more Dragons episodes coming out soon!
The animation was indeed very good as was the story for an animated movie.  It is wonderful entertainment for the entire family.

I love the lessons that this is passively teaching my children: sharing, communication, acceptance and tolerance.  This whole series is all goodness, and the stories and characters are complex enough that my husband and I secretly enjoy watching them as well.  ;-)

I collect dragons so watched the first of these shows out of curiosity. The dragons are nothing like I collect but I was immediately sucked in by the different characters and the very different dragons. I'm 57 and my sister is 55 and we now own both movies and we watch the series on television. In fact, I bought her seasons 1 & 2 for her birthday and Christmas. The show has a lot of action and the humor is wonderful. How often these days do you watch a show and find yourself actually laughing out loud? We do with this series.

We bought both part 1 and part 1, VERY happy with the series.  Good story lines, entertaining and best of all the episodes are about 23 mins long so we can parcel out 1, 2 or 3 episodes at night after his bath and before bedtime depending on how late it is.
Our 5yr old LOVES this series.  Looking forward to the next one coming out.

Fun, entertaining, good way to pass the time.

We enjoyed this DVD plus Part 1. It was a Christmas gift for my husband, who is a total fan of the movie.

They're definitely not like the movie, but were worth purchasing and watching with the kids.

I'm not generally a big fan of sequels, or TV shows based on a movie, but we have enjoyed this one from the movie on, and the series is no exception.  This is actually the second half of the first year of the cartoon series, and the episodes are fun, creative and fantastic, but you HAVE to like dragons.  Even if you just barely like dragons, you will be enthralled with the series.  The heroes are viking teenagers, who fight evil from the backs of dragons, and their antics and exploits, as expected, are exciting, amusing, and the stuff of legend!
the code to play school of dragon game, does not work. both part 1 & part 2. so why buy the dvd?
Surprisingly about as high quality in writing, style, and animation as the movie.  My son couldn't stop talking about the new dragons!
My girls love watching this over and over again. Very good for the whole family to enjoy. Recommended for any child or adult who just wants something fun to watch.
My great grandkids absolutely love Hiccup and Toothless. Couldn't have picked a better Christmas present. Just hope there will be more of this show to come.

This is a fun series.  I loved "How to Train Your Dragon" and am pleased to see this series showing how the people of Berk adjust to life with dragons and adds more personality and background to all the main characters.  The animation and technical aspect is below that of the movie, but above "Saturday Cartoon" grade.  The follow-on series will likely be just as enjoyable and I presume all this will serve to lead up to the movie sequel, coming out in June 2014.
Just as much fun as the first series.would recommend this for any age, graphics are great ,story are well told

The boys are not allowed to watch TV late on school nights, and these episodes came on during those prohibited times, so they were VERY happy to receive these (I bought them both parts 1 and 2) episodes!!!

My son and I love How To Train Your Dragon, so when I saw this on Amazon, I knew I had to order it. Although I ordered both Part 1 and 2 at the same time, 2 came in first, however, we were none the wiser. These episodes are great! The character voices seem the same and the quality of animation is the same. We look forward to part 1 coming in...and part 3, 4 ....

A fan of animation since I was a child, I've grown used to shows in recent years that operate on two levels, for the primary target audience and for adults (like Phineas and Ferb, the Batman Animated series and Penguins of Madagascar).  This is clearly intended more for children.  That isn't to say it isn't  entertaining, just that it wasn't quite at the level I was hoping it would be.

For younger viewers, I think it would be a much better choice.
bought as a gift for a 5 year old. he was thrilled with it.  was delivered quickly and it perfect condition.
Great animation. Loved watching the further adventures of Toothless and Hiccup. The kids loved it to. Looking forward to the next season.

I would like to express my disappointment in Cartoon Networks/Dreamworks insatiable greed. I love certain programs like Adventure Time. However, I am outraged on how there are now, not one, but five random selections of episodes out on DVD. I will take time out of my day to make sure reviews on all websites that sell these partial seasons will clearly tell people how CN/DW is driven by greed and not to buy these mixed seasons and not to support partial season DVDs. You can put crap in a shiny box and call it a favor, but it is still crap. So many customers demand full seasons ONLY! You may fool the average consumer, but with a little education, my fellow peers will have their eyes opened to CN/DW's deceit of its customers and insatiable greed. What ever happened to producing quality products? What ever happened to companies that didn't try to gouge the customer and fool them into thinking they are getting a good deal? The DVD's cost you way less than a dollar to produce, but yet you want to try and fool the common customer to buy these mixed seasons of wonderful shows. Sadly, taking care of the customer and offering quality products appears to be a thing of the past.

Please don't hack up the dream works dragons of Burke when you put those seasons out on DVD. I will follow the releases and also educate the average customer on your business tactics and lack of general ethics. My voice will be heard, if not by CN/DW, but by the average consumer.

I don't normally complain, but I am sick and tired of large companies scamming and price gouging the loyal fans for the sake of a few extra bucks. America is no longer a producer of quality, now it seems we are a producer of deception and greed. You should be ASHAMED CARTOON NETWORK/DREAMWORKS!

It's so nice they included every episode from the first season when you purchase Part 1 and Part 2 together.  This is definitely a fun series and has made it easier for those of us who can't wait for the next feature film to come out.
Just wish there were more than 3-4 episodes per disc.  Not quite as good as the movie but still entertaining and the characters are just as much fun to watch.  The kids like them too...lol.

I bought these (Part 1 and 2) as a gift--but I love them too. Just hope they come out with more new episodes soon--so we don't have to just keep watching same ones over and over! Although we haven't tired of them yet!

I would be wary of my toddlers watching it, even though it is a cartoon, because many of the scenes are intense.  The story is fun, though, if you like How to Train Your Dragon.
